elements.title: Antimonumento 49 ABC
elements.contents: ... that sculptures of children's shoes at the Antimonumento 49 ABC (pictured)—honoring those killed in a fire—were later stolen?

elements.title: Class
elements.contents: ... that marmalade, mashed potato and fish knives were all used in the book Class to identify different British social classes?

elements.title: Nizaa language
elements.contents: ... that until the 1990s, linguists often confused the Nizaa language with a similarly named local language?

elements.title: Julian Yacoub Mourad
elements.contents: ... that Julian Yacoub Mourad, an archbishop of the Syriac Catholic Church, escaped from the Islamic State after being held captive for more than four months?

elements.title: Mobile Defence Corps
elements.contents: ... that the role of the British Mobile Defence Corps was to carry out rescue work in the aftermath of a nuclear attack?

elements.title: a Texas TV station
elements.contents: ... that the chairman of the board of a Texas TV station was found to have died from drinking cyanide-laced cola?

elements.title: Push 2 Start
elements.contents: ... that Tyla became the second female African artist to score multiple solo entries on the Billboard Hot 100 with "Push 2 Start"?

elements.title: Phyllis Chen
elements.contents: ... that pianist Phyllis Chen started playing the smaller toy piano after both her arms became sore from tendinopathy?

elements.title: Welwitschia mirabilis
elements.contents: ... that Welwitschia mirabilis only ever grows two leaves, which last for the plant's entire life?
